article.headline: Columbia 90, Brown 81
article.story: PROVIDENCE, R.I. (AP) -- Patrick Powers scored a career-high 34 points as Brown defeated Columbia 90-81 on Saturday. Dalen Cuff scored 23 points and Matt Preston scored 22 for Columbia. Down 57-48, the Lions (6-14, 2-4 Ivy league) rallied for nine straight points in a 2:31 span, tying the game at 57 with 14:20 left. Brown retook the lead, 64-62, only to see Maurice Murphy, Dalen Cuff, and Tito Hill hit back-to-back-to-back 3-pointers in less than a minute, putting Columbia ahead 71-64 with 9:03 to play. The Bears (8-11, 4-2) responded with a 12-0 run, capped off by a Powers dunk and free throw, which gave Brown a 76-71 lead with 5:25 remaining. Hill and Cuff each converted 3-pointers, reducing the deficit to 78-77 at the 3:40 mark. Brown scored six straight points over the next 1:22, with Jason Forte's 3-pointer giving the Bears an 84-77 edge with 2:18 to play. The Lions again closed the gap, closing the lead to 84-81, only to be held scoreless for the final 1:43 of the game. The two teams combined for 23 3-pointers, with Powers and Cuff each sinking six. The Lions jumped out to a 24-16 lead with 11:18 left in the first half. But Brown, down 34-33 with 4:42 remaining, ended the half with a 16-7 run for a 51-40 halftime lead. Forte scored 23 points for the Bears, including 12 of 12 from the free throw line, while Kilburn added 13. Brown made 31 of 35 free-throw attempts, while Columbia hit 11 of 13.
